required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Versus Radiofrequency Ablation for Small Renal Masses
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Randomized Pilot Trial of Stereotactive Body Radiation Therapy Versus Radiofrequency Ablation for the Management of Small Renal Masses.

brief_summary.textblock: The execution of this study is pertinent to evaluating SBRT's short- and long-term efficacy and safety in the treatment of SRMs. This study will be the first to compare RFA and SBRT in the treatment of SRMs.

primary_outcome.description: Failure will be defined as enhancement of ablated tissue greater than 10 Hounsfield units by CT contrast.
Defined as disease-free survival rate after a single procedure
Defined as disease recurrence rate after a single procedure, including positive biopsy result.

secondary_outcome.description: Average percentage decrease in tumor size.
Change in eGRF measured by mL/min/1.73m2.
Change in serum creatinine level measured by umol/L.
Change in creatinine clearance measured by ml/minute.

Intra and post intervention complication rates will be documented in terms of nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, hematuria, hemorrhage (requiring or not requiring transfusion), perinephric hematoma, ureteral strictures, loss of a renal unit, urinary leak, bleeding, fever and flulike symptoms, stomach/bowel ulceration, ureteropelvic junction obstruction, and upper pole hydrocalycosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients that experienced an adverse event.
secondary_outcome.description: Defined by any adverse event listed in the CTCAE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in score for quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Defined by the generic EuroQol (EQ-5D) questionnaire that is a standardized measure of health. A scale of 0-100 (0 being the worse health, and 100 being the best health), is used for a patient to define their overall health and wellbeing.
Duration of length of hospital stay (if applicable)
Defined by total cost of procedure and any associated related adverse events post procedure.

intervention.description: RFA probe will create an ablation zone of a 1.0 cm diameter beyond the maximum CT-measured tumor diameter. The generator will modulate power up to 150 W in reach average ablative temperature of 105oC. Tumors will be treated for two cycles of 8 minutes duration each upon reaching target temperatures.

The Gross Tumour Volume (GTV) is defined as the visible tumour seen on the planning CT simulation. No clinical target volume (CTV) for microscopic disease is necessary. The internal target volume (ITV) accounts for changes in tumour position due to respiration, and is assessed on 4DCT. The planning target volume (PTV) will be a standard 0.5 cm around the ITV.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients ≥18 years of age and capable of providing informed consent
- Patients scheduled for treatment of their SRM using SBRT or RFA
- Patients who received a biopsy of their SRM prior to their scheduled SBRT or RFA treatment
- Patients who are willing to have a biopsy 12 months post-procedure
- Patients with renal tumor(s) ≤ 4.0 cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with large renal tumor(s)>4.0 cm
- Patients who are unable to have a general anesthetic
- Patients who did not receive a biopsy of their SRM prior to their scheduled SBRT or RFA treatment
- Patients who are unable to comply with post-operative and/or follow-up protocol/phase of study
- Evidence of metastatic disease
- Uncorrectable bleeding diathesis

facility.name: McMaster Institute of Urology - St. Joseph's Healthcare Hamilton
